Peaches are not citrus fruits. Citrus fruits include oranges, lemons, limes, grapefruits, etc. Peaches belong to the stone fruit or drupe family (Prunus) along with plums, cherries, apricots, and nectarines. 

So the answer to "Is it a citrus fruit?" is "no".

content.thinking:
I need to answer the question about whether a peach has a pit or stone inside with just "yes" or "no".

Peaches do indeed have a large, hard pit (also called a stone) in the center. The pit contains the seed of the peach. Peaches are classified as "stone fruits" or "drupes" precisely because they have this characteristic pit.

So the correct answer is "yes".

content.text: ANSWER: yes

So I would say yes, peaches are typically yellow or orange in color when ripe.
